intro: Peliosanthes nutans, commonly known as the hanging sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly in Namibia and South Africa. The plant is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white. Its leaves are fleshy and succulent, adapted to store water in its native environment. The species is often found in rocky crevices or on sand dunes, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
